body.p: A W Mooney says that he is Citizen of Dixon the County seat of Webster County Ky that he is well acquainted with John A Brooks late of said town. That said Brooks is said now to be in the Teritory of Colorodo That Brooks has a wife and child now living in Dixon -- That Brooks was a practising lawyer in the Webster Circuit Court That he was said to be a comissioned lieutenant in the regiment of Col A R Johnson of the Army of the so Called Confederate States during the year 1862 or a part there of That during the early part of the year 1863 he took the oath of allegiance gave bond and was released by Col Foster Commander of the Post at Henderson That he returned to his home in Dixon and behaved himself well and peacebly during the time he remained and attended to his business as a lawyer but that during the summer of 1864 some officers and soldiers of the 52nd Ky Regiment passed through Dixon & Without any apparent Cause threatened said Brooks and ordered him to leave the Country which he did and which in affiants estimation it was prudent and safe for him to do There was at the time great prejudice in the minds of the Federal Soldiery against those who had been in the Rebel army an^d^ especially those under the said A R Johnson
Subscribed and sworn to by A W Mooney before me the 24th day of June 1865
Wm Herron J P W C
